Tip number 1: Don't use too much smoke.
If you smoke it too much it kind of gets a chemical taste to it. It's just too much smoke, so don't use too much wood.
Another issue is don't under season it, make sure you are using enough salt.
Usually you have a big piece of meat, you need enough salt to... to...to season the whole thing.
Uhh third thing, cook it long enough.
Most people are...are impatient...and Bar-B-Q is one of those things it's done when it's done. And just take your time with it.
It's just you'll just...just know, and just practice at it and be patient with it and it'll be good.
It's been amazing, and this is my Lost and Hungry tip for you
that if you are ever in the Phoenix area you need to come to this place, Little Miss BBQ
and hang out with the guys. And just eat some amazing food.
